data.text:
EARTHWORKS

Aldiss, Brian W.

Garden City, New York: Doubleday and Company, Inc., 1966. Book Club Edition. Cloth. SIGNED and INSCRIBED by the Author on the title page to Greg Gatenby, who has his SIGNATURE on the free front endpaper, 8vo, tan cloth with black lettering on spine, Mylar-protected pcitorial dust jacket (unclipped), 152 pages. Near Fine / Near Fine. Item #3211

SIGNED by the author on the title page and inscribed by him to Greg Gatenby--Canadian writer and founder of the International Festival of Authors. From the collection of Canadian author/literary impresario Greg Gatenby with his signature on the free front endpaper.

Aldiss is famous for his numerous Sci-Fi novels (e.g., Non-Stop [1958], The Primal Urge [1961], Hothouse [1962], Frankenstein Unbound [1973], the Helliconia Trilogy [1982-85]); as well as short stories (e.g., No Time Like Tomorrow [1959], Neanderthal Planet [1970], "Super-Toys Last All Summer Long"--the basis for Spielberg's, A.I. Artificial Intelligence). Aldiss is a VP of the international H. G. Wells Society, and has won nearly every prestigious Sci-Fi award.

INSCRIBED & in CLEAN, BRIGHT, TIGHT CONDITION! Light surface wear to dust jacket. Small pencil-sized dot on front cover.
